abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of Infrastructure
            Development Project for Sierra Leone is to rehabilitate
            selected priority roads, port and airport facilities of the
            recipient; and to support the regulatory and institutional
            reform and effective management of the recipient's
            road, port and airport sectors. The restructuring paper
            proposes extension of closing date from March 31, 2013 to
            September 13, 2013. The extension is necessary to allow for
            the completion of the ongoing rehabilitation of the feeder
            roads. Major port reforms have been undertaken resulting in
            improved operational efficiency at the port; road
            maintenance funding and management of works have been
            separated and expected to lead to more effective management
            of sector expenditures. Increased disbursement activities
            are expected in the next few months as project activities
            are completed.
